headline: AI helps drive record $11.8 billion in Black Friday online spending
summary: AI-powered shopping tools helped drive a surge in U.S. online spending on Black Friday, as shoppers bypassed crowded stores and turned to chatbots to compare prices and secure discounts amid concerns ​about tariff-driven price hikes.  U.S. shoppers spent a record $11.8 billion online, up 9.1% from 2024 on the year'‌s biggest shopping day, according to Adobe Analytics, which tracks 1 trillion visits that shoppers make to online retail websites.  The AI-driven traffic to U.S. retail sites soared 805% compared ‌to last year, Adobe said, when artificial intelligence tools such as Walmart's Sparky or Amazon's Rufus had not yet been launched.

content.title: AI helps drive record $11.8 billion in Black Friday online spending
content.summary: AI-powered shopping tools helped drive a surge in U.S. online spending on Black Friday, as shoppers bypassed crowded stores and turned to chatbots to compare prices and secure discounts amid concerns ​about tariff-driven price hikes.  U.S. shoppers spent a record $11.8 billion online, up 9.1% from 2024 on the year'‌s biggest shopping day, according to Adobe Analytics, which tracks 1 trillion visits that shoppers make to online retail websites.  The AI-driven traffic to U.S. retail sites soared 805% compared ‌to last year, Adobe said, when artificial intelligence tools such as Walmart's Sparky or Amazon's Rufus had not yet been launched.

headline: AWS is in last place in AI, but this Amazon bull doesn't care
summary: Amazon's (AMZN) cloud business, Amazon Web Services (AWS), may be in last place among hyperscalers in the artificial intelligence (AI) race, but it doesn't matter, according to Capital Advisors portfolio manager and head of equity David Wagner. Wagner outlines his bullish outlook for Amazon's stock, saying the bears are caught in the weeds of debating who the AI winners and losers are. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Retail Stocks Usually Rise the Week After Black Friday. This BNPL Play Stands Out.
summary: Retail stocks typically rise in the week following Black Friday as Wall Street looks to reap the benefits of people rushing to save while shopping for the holidays—but one name could be a standout in 2025.  Black Friday brings in billions of dollars to U.S. businesses annually as price cuts spur shoppers to participate in the retail event and purchase gifts and everyday essentials.  Shoppers spent $11.8 billion online on Black Friday 2025, according to Adobe, above the firm’s forecast of $11.7 billion and a 9.1% increase from the previous year.

content.title: Retail Stocks Usually Rise the Week After Black Friday. This BNPL Play Stands Out.
content.summary: Retail stocks typically rise in the week following Black Friday as Wall Street looks to reap the benefits of people rushing to save while shopping for the holidays—but one name could be a standout in 2025.  Black Friday brings in billions of dollars to U.S. businesses annually as price cuts spur shoppers to participate in the retail event and purchase gifts and everyday essentials.  Shoppers spent $11.8 billion online on Black Friday 2025, according to Adobe, above the firm’s forecast of $11.7 billion and a 9.1% increase from the previous year.

headline: Netflix Turns To In-Person Shopping Experiences As Gen Z Returns To The Mall
summary: Gen Z is returning to the mall despite living in a life of e-commerce and social media. They're going for the experience as they seek more of the physical world after being key players in the digital world's growth. Gen Z is driving the next wave of retail and sparking a renaissance in the industry, NBC News reported. Companies have adapted to Gen Z's return to the mall, and it can result in malls rebounding from multiple years of decline. Don't Miss: The AI Marketing Platform Backed by Insiders
